data.mission: Locate authoritative online exemplars (images, audio, video, performance clips) that match the provided art & music case studies and thematic categories. For each exemplar, record title, creator, date, medium, persistent URL, licensing information, and — for audio/video — suggested excerpt start/end timestamps; do not download any copyrighted content, only capture metadata and authoritative links.

Design a coherent, testable research framework and study roadmap for longitudinal mixed-methods investigation into how historical narratives of creativity (genius vs. craft/process) shape contemporary arts and music pedagogy, student beliefs, skill development, creative productivity, resilience, and gatekeeping outcomes. Produce operational definitions, candidate measures (survey items, observational protocols, portfolio metrics, and administrative outcome indicators), sampling and longitudinal design options, and a prioritized set of interventions to test for shifting 'genius' myths toward process-oriented mindsets.

Add a single command/script (e.g., validate_outputs.py or Makefile target) that (1) runs the scaffold generator and (2) asserts presence of required files (REPORT_OUTLINE.md, CASE_STUDY_TEMPLATE.md, METADATA_SCHEMA.json, WORKLOG.md), emitting a validation summary to /outputs/logs/validation.txt.

Define METADATA_SCHEMA.json (or JSON Schema) for case studies and implement a minimal CLI (add_case_study) that writes a new case-study JSON/MD stub into /outputs/case_studies/ and validates it against the schema; include fields for rights/licensing and authoritative URLs (no downloads).
